primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Principles of optical, active and passive microwave remote sensing; satellite orbit and sensor characteristics; image processing and analysis techniques and software; and environmental remote sensing applications.
cmCourseInfo.title: Environmental Remote Sensing

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Building on GGR315H1 (formerly GGR337H1) Environmental Remote Sensing with advanced theories and techniques for land cover mapping, vegetation biophysical and biochemical parameter retrievals, optical and thermal remote sensing of urban environment, and application of satellite remote sensing to terrestrial water and carbon cycle estimation. Basic radiative transfer theories as applied to vegetation will be given in some detail as the basis for various remote sensing applications. Optical instruments for measuring vegetation structural parameters will be demonstrated in the field.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Remote Sensing

breadthTypes.description: BR=5 The Physical and Mathematical Universes

Legend 1

sub legend 1
ANT102H5F

The first 3 characters denote subject, the next 3 denote course number and course level.

ANT = Anthropology
1** = First year course
102 = Course number		 ANT102H5F

The next character denotes the credit value of the course.

H = Half credit course (0.5 credit)
Y = Full credit course (1.0 credit)		 ANT102H5F

The next character denotes the campus.

1 = St. George Campus
3 = Scarborough Campus
5 = UTM Campus

 ANT102H5F

The final character denotes the term.

F = First term course (Sept. to Dec.)
S = Second term course (Jan. to Apr.)
Y = Year course (Sept. to Apr.)
LEC0101

The first 3 characters denote type of section.
LEC = Lecture
PRA = Practical (Lab)
TUT = Tutorial

LEC0101

The last four digits indicate the meeting section number.

P = Priority. Some students are given priority access.

E = Enrolment on ACORN is disabled. Students must enrol through the department.

R = Restricted. Course is restricted at all times for specific students
R1 = Restricted. Course is restricted at all times for specific students until specified date. After this date, enrolment is granted to additional groups of eligible students only.

A = Approval. Departmental approval is required
AP = Departmental approval is required for enrolment. Some students are given priority access.
AR = Departmental approval is required. Course is restricted at all times for specific students.

Delivery Modes of Classes

  • IN PERSON: This meeting section is in-person. You will be required to attend this meeting section at a specific time and location. The course outline will provide specific details.
  • HYBRID: This meeting section includes in-person and online activities. You will be required to attend some activities in-person at a specific time and location and some activities online (synchronous or asynchronous). The course outline will provide specific details.
  • ONLINE SYNCHRONOUS: This meeting section is online and requires attendance at a specific time for class activities. Note: Online courses may require an in-person mid term and final assessment. The course outline will provide specific details.
  • ONLINE ASYNCHRONOUS: This meeting section is online and does not require attendance at a specific time for class activities. Note: Online courses may require an in-person mid term and final assessment. The course outline will provide specific details.
  • Not all courses listed in the Calendar are offered in each session.

  • Year 1 students (0 - 3.5 credits) will be blocked from registering into most C and D level courses as they do not meet pre-requisite requirements. Please check pre-requisite requirements before registering into courses. Students may be removed from courses that they do not meet the pre-requisite requirements for at any time.

  • Please go to AccessAbility Services for information about classroom accessibility
  • Academic Departments

The timetable changes constantly. Check regularly for updates.
divisionalLegends.ARTSC:
Enrolment Controls

Enrolment Controls
P Priority Some students are given priority access until a specific date.
E Enrol at Department Students must contact the sponsoring Department to enrol.
A Approval Required Approval from academic unit required for enrolment.
AP Approval Required with Priority Some students are given priority access until a specific date and approval from academic unit required for enrolment.
R1 Restricted Course/section is restricted at all times for specific students.
R2 Restricted Course/section is restricted to a group of students until a specific date, after which time another group of students is also able to enrol.
AR1 Restricted with Approval Approval required from academic unit for enrolment, course is also restricted to specific student groups.
AR2 Restricted with Approval Approval required from academic unit for enrolment, course is also restricted to specific student groups until a specific date after which another group of students will be able to request enrolment.


Delivery Modes

Visit the Course Planning page on the A&S website for additional delivery method and course planning details.


Delivery Methods
In Person This meeting section is in person. You will be required to attend this meeting section at a specific time and location. The course outline will provide specific details.
Hybrid This meeting section includes in-person and online activities. You will be required to attend some activities in person at a specific time and location and some activities online (synchronous or asynchronous). The course outline will provide specific details.
Online - Synchronous

This meeting section is online and requires attendance at a specific time for class activities.

Note: Online courses may require an in-person final assessment. For Y courses, both midterm tests and final assessments may be in person. The course outline will provide specific details. 
Online - Asynchronous

This meeting section is online and does not require attendance at a specific time for class activities.

Note: Online courses may require an in-person final assessment. For Y courses, midterm tests and final assessments may be in person. The course outline will provide specific details.

ARTSC.name: Enrolment via ACORN is not available. Students must request permission to enrol in this course by contacting the sponsoring department
Restricted: Course/section is restricted at all times for specific students.

Restricted: Course/section is restricted at all times for specific students. NOTE: Spaces for each priority group in this course are not equal, and each priority group has its own waitlist until July 23. As of July 25, the waitlists for each priority group merge into one, and your rank on the waitlist may change.
